channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump administration sends letter wiping out addiction, mental health grants
item.description: The Trump administration sent hundreds of letters Tuesday terminating federal grants supporting mental health and drug addiction services.

item.title: The death toll from a crackdown on protests in Iran jumps to over 2,500, activists say
item.description: The number of dead climbed to at least 2,571 early Wednesday, as reported by the U.S.-based Human Rights Activists News Agency, as Iranians made phone...

item.title: New analysis on U.S. economy. And, MN prosecutors quit over DOJ probe into Good widow
item.description: Trump pitches affordability on a national tour to combat voter frustration. And, Minnesota federal prosecutors resign after DOJ pressure to probe Rene...

item.title: Greetings from Acre, Israel, where an old fortress recalls the time of the Crusades
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: The risks of AI in schools outweigh the benefits, report says
item.description: A new report warns that AI poses a serious threat to children's cognitive development and emotional well-being.

item.title: Clintons won't testify in Epstein probe as House Oversight GOP threatens contempt
item.description: Republican Rep. James Comer of Kentucky, the committee's chairman, said the panel will move next week on holding them in contempt.

item.title: Latest news on Trump's threats against Iran as fears of hangings persist
item.description: President Trump is threatening "very strong action" against Iran as the regime contemplates executions for anti-government protesters. CBS News' Natal...

item.title: Chew on this: U.S. food prices are still up 19% since 2022
item.description: Food prices in December saw their biggest jump in more than three years, data shows, while the cost of eating out has also risen.

item.title: Amateur stuns world's best to win A$1m in Melbourne
item.description: Amateur Jordan Smith is the shock winner of the Million Dollar One Point Slam at the Australian Open, beating reigning men's champion Jannik Sinner al...

item.title: Trump vows 'very strong action' if Iran executes protesters
item.description: Relatives of an arrested protester tell BBC Persian he is due to be executed on Wednesday, as the death toll from demonstrations reportedly exceeds 2,...

item.title: What to know as Iran faces its biggest anti-government protests in years
item.description: Many Iranian opposition activists are hoping the current unrest could be the beginning of the end of the country's hardline Islamic regime.

item.title: LA opens ticket draw for 2028 Olympics - with seats starting at $28
item.description: If chosen via the draw, fans will be notified via email and will be given a time slot to purchase tickets in April.

item.title: Vance, Rubio meeting with Greenland and Denmark's foreign ministers
item.description: The meeting comes one day after Greenland's Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen said at a news conference, "If we have to choose between the United S...

item.title: At least 32 killed after crane collapses on train in Thailand
item.description: Sixty-four people were left injured, including a one-year-old and an 85-year-old.

item.title: 'Grim scene': BBC on site after crane collapses on train in Thailand
item.description: Correspondent Jonathan Head says the 'devastating' accident is an enormous setback for Thailand's efforts to modernise its infrastructure.

item.title: Minneapolis duo details their ICE detention, including pressure to rat on protest organizers
Minnesota protesters, agents repeatedly square off while prosecutors quit after Renee Good’s death
item.description: Days of demonstrations against immigration agents and a new lawsuit have left Minnesota tense. Federal officers sprayed eye irritant and dropped tear ...

item.title: Wisconsin Gov. Evers questions his lieutenant governor’s immigration enforcement proposal
